newsitem.title: SPAIN: Spain parl to form committee to probe "lost" taxes.
newsitem.headline: Spain parl to form committee to probe "lost" taxes.

text.p: Spanish parliamentary groups backed the creation of a special parliamentary committee on Wednesday to investigate exactly what happened to 202 billion pesetas' worth of unpaid taxes which the authorities may now be unable to collect.

Earlier this month, Secretary of the Exchequer Juan Costa raised a political furore when he blamed the unpaid taxes on mismanagement and delays from the former Socialist governmnet, which lost elections in 1996 after 13 years in power.

Addressing parliament on Wednesday, Costa said the previous government had showed only "scant interest" in the case. The shortfall is alleged to have occurred during the last five years the Socialists were in power.
Costa said that the 202 billion pesetas, corresponding to around 4,700 tax cases, could no longer be collected as the Socialists had been deliberately vacillating.
Under Spanish law, contested tax monies cannot be collected if an enquiry into a tax discrepancy lasts for more than six months.
Costa has said these funds are not taken into account in the budget, and do not affect the public deficit.
